page.title: 18A Newborough village garden
page.content: { Of 1/3 acre}almost half is lawn with plum, apple, pear and cherry trees. The rest is divided between flowers, vegetables and shrubs. { Contents}include six hanging baskets, nine tubs of flowers, bird table and drinking fountain, garden shed and greenhouse. { A hedge}down one side includes hawthorn, holly, elderberry and blackberry and is trimmed once a year. On outside walls are vines, clematis, pyracanthus and virginia creeper. { Climate}has average rainfall, strong winds and a risk of frost pockets. { The soil}is easy to work, full of spiders and snails and grows weeds abundantly - docks, buttercups and nettles. It is good for beans, peas, potatoes, cabbage and cauliflower; not as good for root vegetables. Crops will last 2 people for 6 months.
